title: The Seven Last Plagues
shortSummary: Revelation 15 reveals a powerful vision of seven angels preparing to pour out God's final and complete wrath through the last plagues. It depicts the victorious saints praising God and the opening of the heavenly temple, emphasizing God's holiness, justice, and sovereign judgment.
timeline: c. AD 95 - The Revelation given to John during his exile on Patmos

keyCharacters.name: John
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and author of Revelation who receives and records the vision of the seven last plagues.

keyCharacters.name: Seven Angels
keyCharacters.description: Heavenly messengers entrusted with the seven last plagues, symbolizing the final outpouring of God's wrath.

keyCharacters.name: The Victorious Saints
keyCharacters.description: Believers who have overcome the beast, his image, mark, and number, standing on the sea of glass with harps of God, praising Him.

keyCharacters.name: One of the Four Beasts
keyCharacters.description: A living creature in heaven who gives the seven angels the golden vials filled with God's wrath.

definitions.definition: A symbolic, transparent expanse representing purity and separation, here mingled with fire to signify judgment and holiness.
Musical instruments used by the saints in heaven to sing praises, symbolizing worship and victory.

definitions.term: Temple of the Tabernacle of the Testimony
definitions.definition: The heavenly sanctuary where God's presence dwells and where the seven angels receive the plagues, representing divine authority.
Containers holding the wrath of God to be poured out as the seven last plagues, symbolizing the completeness and holiness of God's judgment.

outline.heading: The Vision of the Seven Last Plagues
outline.description: John sees a great and marvelous sign in heaven: seven angels holding the seven last plagues, which complete God's wrath, highlighting the certainty and severity of divine judgment.

outline.heading: The Victorious Saints and Their Song
outline.description: The saints who overcame the beast stand on a fiery sea of glass, singing the song of Moses and the Lamb, praising God's marvelous works, holiness, and just judgments.

outline.heading: The Opening of the Heavenly Temple
outline.description: John witnesses the opening of the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven, from which the seven angels emerge clothed in pure linen and golden girdles, symbolizing their divine authority.

outline.heading: The Seven Angels Receive the Golden Vials
outline.description: One of the four living creatures gives the seven angels golden vials filled with the eternal wrath of God, emphasizing the solemnity and finality of the coming judgments.

outline.heading: The Temple Filled with God's Glory
outline.description: The temple is filled with smoke from God's glory and power, preventing anyone from entering until the seven plagues are completed, underscoring God's holiness and the irrevocable nature of His judgment.

application: Trust in God's perfect justice and holiness even amid trials, knowing He will ultimately judge evil completely.
Rejoice and worship God as victorious saints, remembering that faithfulness to Christ leads to overcoming spiritual battles.
Approach God with reverence and awe, recognizing His sovereign authority and the seriousness of His judgments.
Commit to obedience and perseverance, standing firm against the temptations and pressures symbolized by the beast and his mark.

keyVerses.text: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvellous, seven angels having the seven last plagues; for in them is filled up the wrath of God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse introduces the final and complete outpouring of God's wrath, marking the climax of divine judgment.

keyVerses.text: And they sing the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and marvellous are thy works, Lord God Almighty; just and true are thy ways, thou King of saints.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the worship of the victorious saints, affirming God's justice and majesty as central to His character.

keyVerses.text: And one of the four beasts gave unto the seven angels seven golden vials full of the wrath of God, who liveth for ever and ever.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the divine authority and eternal nature of God's wrath being executed through the seven angels.

keyVerses.text: And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God, and from his power; and no man was able to enter into the temple, till the seven plagues of the seven angels were fulfilled.
keyVerses.significance: It underscores God's holiness and the solemnity of the forthcoming judgments, showing that no one can approach God until His purposes are accomplished.
